metadata.description: Complete equipment, weapons, armor, and item database for Fallout TTRPG

ammunition.name: 9mm
ammunition.flavor: Plenty Of Stopping Power, Seriously. Stop Laughing.

ammunition.name: 10mm
ammunition.description: The preferred choice of Pre-War Police and the American Military.
ammunition.flavor: Good Enough For The FBI HRT

ammunition.name: .357 Magnum
ammunition.flavor: Bad Guys, Good Guys, What's The Difference?

ammunition.name: .223 Remington
ammunition.description: Accurate rifle round; used in carbines and pistols.
ammunition.flavor: Perfect For Deer And Larger Game

ammunition.name: 7.62mm NATO
ammunition.flavor: The Right Side Of The Wall

ammunition.name: 12-Gauge Flechette
ammunition.flavor: For When You Really Want Someone To Have A Bad Day

ammunition.name: Small Energy Cell
ammunition.flavor: The BADTFL Says We Can Sell It In Home Goods

ammunition.name: Electron Charge Pack
ammunition.flavor: H+H Tools And The US Navy Recommend Discharging Every 16 Hours

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.flavor: Much Cruder Than The "H+H Tool Depot" spear

weapons.name: Crowbar
weapons.description: Tool and weapon; grants leverage in certain actions.

weapons.name: Board
weapons.flavor: Boy, Plank, how the heck did we ever end up here?

weapons.name: Axe
weapons.flavor: Popular at viking raids and hipster bars

weapons.name: Machete
weapons.flavor: The Right Arm of the Global South

weapons.name: Lacerators
weapons.flavor: Perfect For The Modern Kitchen Or Wasteland Dust-Up

weapons.name: Mace Glove
weapons.flavor: Somebody has scratched 'Iron Mike' into the head of the mace

weapons.name: Spiked Knuckles
weapons.flavor: What The Fuck Is An Echidna?

weapons.name: Adamantine Claws
weapons.flavor: Somethin' don't smell quite right about you, bub.

weapons.name: Power Fist
weapons.flavor: You Should See The Other Guy

weapons.name: 9mm Pistol
weapons.flavor: How Do You Solve A Problem Like Maria?

weapons.name: .223 Pistol
weapons.description: Cut-down rifle action; very high penetration.

weapons.name: Needler Pistol
weapons.description: Fires darts; specialized toxin rounds available.

weapons.name: Laser Pistol
weapons.description: Wattz 2000 Laser Pistol. Packs a hot punch.

weapons.name: Throwing Knife
weapons.description: Balanced for throwing; can also be used as a knife.
weapons.flavor: What do you say, Jen? One more time for the sweet souvenir?

weapons.name: Throwing Spike
weapons.description: Heavy throwing spike; no melee MD bonus.

weapons.name: Frag Grenade
weapons.description: Damages target hex, adjacent hexes, and deals concussion damage outward.
weapons.flavor: Please Don't Pull It With Your Teeth

weapons.name: Molotov Cocktail
weapons.description: Ignites target area; can start spreading fires.

weapons.name: Pulse Grenade
weapons.flavor: Will Stancil Keeps These On a Deadman's Switch

weapons.name: Javelin
weapons.flavor: You Never Had The Makings Of A Varsity Athlete

weapons.name: Boomerang
weapons.description: May return to thrower with successful Agility check (GM discretion).

weapons.name: Pipe Rifle
weapons.flavor: Perfect For Shooting Womp Rats At Toshi Station

weapons.name: Hunting Rifle
weapons.flavor: Not fast. Not flashy. Not forgiving.

weapons.name: Service Rifle
weapons.description: Standard military rifle in semiautomatic mode.

weapons.name: Sniper Rifle
weapons.description: Precision long-range rifle; ideal for targeted shots.

weapons.name: Anti-Materiel Rifle
weapons.description: Heavy rifle capable of piercing armor; high recoil.

weapons.name: Combat Shotgun
weapons.flavor: They're Coming Out Of The Walls!

weapons.name: 10mm SMG
weapons.description: Strong stopping power with notable recoil.

weapons.name: Tommy Gun
weapons.description: Heavy full-auto SMG with high magazine capacity.

weapons.name: HK P90c
weapons.description: Compact SMG with strong armor penetration.
weapons.flavor: Germany Knows A Thing Or Two About Putting Guns In Tanks

weapons.name: R91 Assault Rifle
weapons.flavor: Right Arm Of The Free World

weapons.name: H&K G11
weapons.description: Fires caseless ammo; extremely high burst rate.
weapons.flavor: You Look Like Captain Cosmos With That Thing

weapons.name: XL70E3
weapons.description: Advanced modular bullpup rifle with high accuracy.
weapons.flavor: Where Do You Even Get Parts For That?

weapons.name: Light Machine Gun
weapons.description: Squad-level light machine gun with strong sustained fire.

weapons.name: M60 Machine Gun
weapons.description: Pre-war military GPMG with high reliability.
weapons.flavor: Anyone that runs is a Raider. Anyone that stands still is a well disciplined Raider.

weapons.name: Bozar (Hybrid LMG/Sniper Platform)
weapons.description: Unique precision machine gun with exceptional accuracy.
weapons.flavor: Something's Off About This Fire Rate...

weapons.name: Vindicator Minigun
weapons.description: Rotary-barrel minigun with immense suppressive fire.

weapons.name: Avenger Minigun
weapons.flavor: Who Took The Gun Off The Vertibird?

weapons.name: CZ53 Personal Minigun
weapons.description: High-end pre-war rotary weapon; top-tier damage output.

weapons.name: Plastic Explosives
weapons.description: C-14 is an improved version of the classic C-4 plastic explosive. A gummy-like substance that can be rigged to detonate, plastique is useful because it can be molded to any shape.
weapons.flavor: The Last Playdough You'll Ever Use

weapons.name: Dynamite
weapons.description: An explosive device consisting of several sticks of dynamite, a detonator, and a timer to set it off. Setting dynamite takes a successful roll against the Explosives skill, while disarming uses the Traps skill. Dynamite does 1d20+30 points of damage to anything in its hex and all adjacent hexes when it goes off, and 1d6 points of concussion damage to anything within 4 hexes of the explosion.

armor.name: Robe
armor.description: Although this garment can be awkward to fight in, it offers some basic protection against some kinds of attacks. More of a fashion statement than an actual effective piece of armor.

armor.name: Leather Jacket
armor.description: The most basic protection you can use. And it looks pretty cool, too. Why? Simple: the Fonz wore a leather jacket. What's the Fonz like? He's cool.
armor.flavor: You dress like a punk, Fonzarelli!

armor.name: Leather Armor
armor.description: A police motorcycle jacket and pants made of leather, padded for extra protection.
armor.flavor: It's that rat circus out there. I'm beginning to enjoy it.

armor.name: Raider Armor
armor.description: A collection of leather and metal plates connected with metal wires, forming a loose-fitting banding. Not the best protection available, but it'll do in a pinch, especially when materials are short.

armor.name: Raider Vandal Armor
armor.description: An improved version of the raider's hodgepodge banding, vandal armor is thick leather strips reinforced with metal and a little Kevlar.

armor.name: Combat Leather Jacket
armor.description: This leather jacket has been padded and reinforced for better protection. You just can't find anything more fashionable in the post-nuclear world.

armor.name: Leather Armor MK II
armor.description: Reinforced leather armor that covers the arms and groin as well as the torso.

armor.name: Metal Armor
armor.description: A jacket of armor made from pieces of scrap metal welded together. Wearing this armor reduces your sneak skill by 25%.

armor.name: Legion Uniform
armor.description: Manufactured by Caesar's Legion, this football armor is banded together from cloth and metal.
armor.flavor: Degenerates Like You Belong On A Cross

armor.name: Ghoul Armor
armor.description: A small set of armor designed for and by ghouls. It is light, and provides only the most basic protection.
armor.flavor: Not Much Left To Shoot Off
armor.requirements: Ghoul or very small humans only

armor.name: Superior Ghoul Armor
armor.description: Leather and metal strips held together by rubber straps. This light armor provides decent protection.
armor.requirements: Ghoul or very small humans only

armor.name: Metal Armor MK II
armor.description: A truly fine suit of armor, crafted by a skilled metalworker. Usually only found in highly populated areas.

armor.name: Metal Armor MK III
armor.description: An advanced version of the Metal Armor.

armor.name: Riot Armor
armor.description: Used by Pre-War Law Enforcement and the Marines, this excellent body armor is made of metal and Kevlar encased in carbon fiber and leather. Economical and sturdy, it is some of the finest armor money can buy in the wastes.

armor.name: Mutant Plate Armor
armor.description: One of the few suits of armor a mutant can wear, this 'suit' consists mostly of strips of leather and metal that form a crude protective covering.
armor.flavor: The Word "UNITY" Is Engraved On The Front

armor.name: Spiked Mutant Plate Armor
armor.description: An improvement on normal mutant plate armor, this suit offers better protection, better craftsmanship, and weights a lot more.

armor.name: Tesla Armor
armor.description: This metal suit of armor is enhanced with electromagnetic coils to aid in protection against energy attacks. Usually found only in high-tech areas.

armor.name: Advanced Tesla Armor
armor.description: The DHS manufactured this improved version of the Tesla Armor. It is usually only worn by Brotherhood technicians.
armor.flavor: This Armor Insists That The Laws Of Physics Work Harder.

armor.name: NCR Combat Armor
armor.description: This combat armor is standard-issue for the New California Republic. This is an advanced version of the Combat Armor, and can occasionally be found for sale in large cities. This suit of armor already has a helmet.

armor.name: Radiation Suit
armor.description: A radiation suit is necessary if someone is going to do any prolonged activity in an irradiated area. While wearing a radiation suit, a person is protected from all the harmful effects of radioactivity and radioactive materials. You cannot wear a helmet with a radiation suit.
armor.flavor: Are You Sure This Place Is Safe?

armor.name: Combat Armor
armor.description: The standard military-issue armor for ground troops before the war, there are still quite a few suits of combat armor lying around. Most are used by police forces in large cities, or by gangsters with lots of money. This suit of armor already has a helmet.

armor.name: Combat Armor MK II
armor.description: An advanced version of the Combat Armor, this offers far better protection. Originally issued to soldiers in the advanced stages of the war. This suit of armor already has a helmet.

armor.name: Advanced Radiation Suit
armor.description: The EPA developed this advanced Hostile Environment suit for operatives in special situations. Combining the protection of a radiation suit with the gas-filtration system of power armors, this armor also offers the user some protection against attacks.

armor.name: Advanced Radiation Suit MK II
armor.description: An advanced version of the Advanced Radiation Suit. Field Tested In Tel Aviv.
armor.flavor: Life's Worth Living When Nature's Giving

armor.name: Pseudo-Chitin Armor
armor.description: This experimental armor was made using genetic engineering. Basically, this armor affords its wearer a complete biological exoskeleton, protecting against a good deal of normal attacks. You cannot wear a helmet with this strange suit of armor.
armor.flavor: Stand up... There you go. You were dreaming.

armor.name: T45d Power Armor
armor.description: This is a metal suit of body armor enhanced with various powered features. Power armor is often the final word in personal protection in the wastes, and is usually only worn by organizations with access to prewar tech.

armor.name: Hardened T45d Power Armor
armor.description: There is a chemical process that makes normal T45d Power Armor harder and better, and this is the result of that process. Like the normal T45d Power Armor, this suit enhances the Strength of the wearer by 3 points.

armor.name: T51b Power Armor
armor.description: This suit of power armor was manufactured by the Brotherhood of Steel for its Paladins after the War. It is amazingly resilient, and fairly stylish, too.
armor.flavor: You Could March This From Anchorage to Nanjing

armor.name: T60a Power Armor
armor.description: An advanced form of power armor. This armor gives a 60% Radiation Resist bonus and a 100/100 Gas Resist bonus with a 20% Poison Resist bonus.

armor.name: Advanced Power Armor
armor.description: Advanced Power Armor is an improvement on normal Power Armor, made mostly by technicians after the war. It is extremely rare and can only be found in organizations that can trace their roots back to the American Armed Services, such as the Enclave. This armor has a built-in night vision system.

armor.name: Advanced Power Armor MK II
armor.description: An improved version of the Advanced Power Armor, the MK II model offers slightly better protection in addition to the 100/100 gas filtration and +4 Strength enhancements. The only group known to have this armor is the Enclave. This suit also has a built-in night vision system.

armor.name: Vault Suit
armor.description: This jumpsuit was given out to residents for the Vault Experiments. Helps members identify as a group, but sticks out like a sore thumb in the Wastes.
armor.flavor: Did You Just Crawl Out From Under A Rock?

armor.name: Wastelander Clothes
armor.description: Although this garment can be awkward to fight in, it offers some basic protection against some kinds of attacks. More of a fashion statement than an actual effective piece of armor.
armor.flavor: At Home In The Brahmin Pens Or The Average Wasteland Watering Hole

armor.name: Armored Vault Suit
armor.description: This jumpsuit was given out to residents for the Vault Experiments. Helps members identify as a group, but sticks out like a sore thumb in the Wastes. This one has been reinforced with strategically placed leather and metal pieces.
armor.flavor: Your Waterchip, Or Your Life. What'll It Be?

armor.name: Tribal Garb
armor.description: A garment not uncommon in small villages and the uncivilized parts of the Wasteland.

armor.name: Pre-War Clothes
armor.description: Although this garment can be awkward to fight in, it offers some basic protection against some kinds of attacks. More of a fashion statement than an actual effective piece of armor.
armor.flavor: A little Mayberry livin', Can go a long way.

armor.name: Tribal Warrior Armor
armor.description: Typical tribal garb, woven with heavier and sturdier pieces of leather and metal, sealed with incantations and blessings from the Great Spirit.

equipment.name: Flare
equipment.description: A chemical-packed stick that, when ignited, will provide light for about an hour.

equipment.name: Lighter
equipment.description: When you need to get that molotov cocktail going, or burn that particular bridge.
equipment.flavor: Pretty Girls Don't Light Their Own Cigarettes

equipment.name: Flashlight
equipment.description: A small flashlight (torch) that runs off of a special energy cell. Usually provides about 30 hours of light before going out.

equipment.name: Rope
equipment.description: What role playing game would be complete without a rope? Perhaps one of the most useful items in the world. Consider this to be about 10 meters long.
equipment.flavor: Hey, this is only enough to... oh

equipment.name: Shovel
equipment.description: A simple shovel for digging and other manual tasks.

equipment.name: Claw Hammer
equipment.description: A useful implement, the claw hammer can pound nails into things, or remove nails from things. Use it to hang all those velvet Elvis' you find in the wastes.

equipment.name: Bobby Pin
equipment.description: Gives the user a +15% bonus to Lockpick ability for the purposes of picking basic locks. Some locks require one of these (or a key) to open.
equipment.flavor: Perfect For Your Girlfriend And Her Box

equipment.name: Tool Set
equipment.description: A set of basic tools, such as small wrenches, pliers, some screwdrivers, and a hammer. For basic repairs.
equipment.flavor: Now Where'd I Put The Socket Wrench...

equipment.name: Boots
equipment.description: A set of reinforced rubber and Kevlar boots. They will protect the wearer from harsh chemicals for a short time, although they tend to wear out easily.

equipment.name: Scalpel
equipment.description: The standard instrument for performing surgeries, this surgical-stainless steel knife is small but incredibly sharp. Not the best tool for a melee fight, but it will do in a pinch. If a character has a scalpel, it adds +10% to his Doctor skill.

equipment.name: Gas Mask
equipment.description: This mask protects against harmful gas by conferring a 100/0 Gas Resistance bonus to the wearer. Useful when someone lobs a mustard gas shell at the party. Note that it does not block radiation.

equipment.name: Expanded Lockpick Set
equipment.description: This little kit contains everything the aspiring thief needs to break into just about anything protected by a traditional lock. Gives a +50% bonus to the Lockpicking skill when used.

equipment.name: Safecracking Kit
equipment.description: The use of this kit is required to open most safes, and gives the user a +20% bonus to their Lockpicking skill when trying to open a safe.

equipment.name: Electronic Lockpick
equipment.description: This valuable device is required to open electronic locks. It is crafted to overload or override the computer security on electronic doors.
equipment.flavor: Perfect for Fort Knox or a Nerd on a Panty Raid

equipment.name: Medical Kit
equipment.description: A first-aid kit that, when used, acts like one successful use of the First Aid skill, healing 1d10 points of damage in 1d10 minutes. Can only be used once.
equipment.flavor: This one has 'Jangles the Moon Monkey' bandages!

equipment.name: Geiger Counter
equipment.description: This useful little device not only detects how much radiation is in a person, it can detect harmful radiation in the surrounding area. Useful when you are wondering if that big glowing crater in the ground is dangerous.
equipment.flavor: Is it supposed to do that?

equipment.name: Doctor's Bag
equipment.description: The Doctor's Bag contains various sawbones instruments for diagnosing and treating various maladies. If a character has a Doctor's Bag, it effectively raises the Doctor skill by 15% for the purposes of treating crippled limbs and blindness only.

equipment.name: Electronic Lockpick Mark II
equipment.description: An improved Electronic Lockpick, used by phreakers, hackers, criminals, and CIA operatives before the War. With this tool, not only can a character open any electronic lock, but it contains a variety of interfaces for other electronic devices like mainframe computers, ATMs, and pocket calculators.
equipment.flavor: If Lost, Return To Jimmy Bond

equipment.name: Pip-Boy 3000A
equipment.description: The Pip-Boy 3000A is a safe, secure piece of Pre-War technology. It guarantees privacy, safety, and guidance in times of need.
equipment.flavor: Can you get holomovies on that thing?

equipment.name: Lockpick Set
equipment.description: Gives the user a +30% bonus to Lockpick ability for the purposes of picking basic locks. Some locks require one of these (or a key) to open.

chems.name: Jet
chems.description: Jet is the new street drug of the post-nuclear world. Jet comes in an inhaler, much like asthma medicine. After inhalation, the user gains +2 Action Points (up to 13), +1 Strength, and +1 Perception for 1d10 hours. After this time, the character loses two Action Points, 3 Strength, and 3 Perception. Jet is 80% addictive.

chems.name: Healing Powder
chems.description: This is a simple healing powder that, when ingested, helps ease pain from minor wounds. It heals 1d10+5 HP when eaten, and causes the user to lose 1 Perception for 1 hour after consumption. Not addictive. The negative effects of this powder are cumulative.
chems.flavor: Don't Forget To Pray To The Healing Spirit

chems.name: Voodoo
chems.description: A tribal concoction made from parts of dead critters (yummy!) Eating this powder makes someone feel invincible. For 30 minutes, Voodoo confers a +2 bonus to Agility, a +3 bonus to Luck, and a 20% bonus to Damage Resistance for Normal attacks only. After a half-hour, the user feels depressed and loses 2 Agility, 3 Luck, and all Damage Resistance from Normal attacks. Voodoo is 20% addictive.
chems.flavor: Do You Trust The Medicine Man?

chems.name: Stimpak
chems.description: Stimpaks are small syringes with healing chems that ease pain and encourage cellular mitosis, helping cells restore themselves at an increased rate. Quite common before the war, they can be found, in one form or another, almost everywhere. When injected, the stimpak heals 1d10+10 HP. Not addictive.

chems.name: Antidote
chems.description: Made from a variety of distilled poisons and antibodies, each dose of Antidote removes one level of poisoning. Antidote tastes and looks like cough syrup, and comes in little bottles. There is no official Antidote company in the wastes, and it is often something that country doctors and traveling quacks will sell for far more than it's worth. Not addictive.
chems.flavor: Hope You're Not Afraid Of Needles

chems.name: Buffout
chems.description: Buffout is a kind of temporary steroid, increasing mitochondrial activity in muscles for a brief period of time. Unfortunately, these same chemicals also impair brain function. When swallowed, Buffout increases the user's Strength by 2, Agility by 2, and Endurance by 3. The effects last one-half (round down) of 1d10 hours. After the effects wear off, the user loses 3 Strength, 3 Agility, and 2 Endurance for 1d10 hours. Buffout carries a 30% chance of addiction.

chems.name: Mentats
chems.description: Mentats increase the user's awareness for a short period of time, but are dangerous because of the intense aftereffects and high addiction rate. When Mentats are swallowed, the user's Perception increases by 2, Intelligence increases by 2, and Charisma increases by 1. The effects last 1 hour, after which time the user's Perception and Intelligence are decreased by 4 and Charisma is decreased by 3 for 1d10 hours. Mentats have a 60% chance of addiction.
chems.flavor: Just repeating a statement often and with great vehemence does not make it a fact, and no amount of repetition can make a rational person believe it.

chems.name: After Burner Gum
chems.description: After Burner was an attempt to legalize a 'safe' form of meth in the early 21st century. Tiny methamphetamine crystals were mixed in with chewing gum. Chewing After Burner gives the user a +1 bonus to Strength and Perception, and raises the user's Action Points by 2, for 1d10 minutes. After that time, the user loses 1 point of Strength and 2 points of Perception for 1 hour. After Burner is 30% addictive.

chems.name: Psycho
chems.description: Psycho is a drug that is much like a combination between Mentats and speed. This chemical cocktail is highly addictive and has horrible side effects, but the high it produces is worth it to many users. After injecting Psycho, the user's Agility increases by 3, and their Intelligence is reduced by 3. The effects of Psycho last 1d10 hours, after which time the user loses 3 points to ALL Stats except Luck for 1d10 hours. Psycho is 50% addictive.
chems.flavor: Perfect For Storming A Shanghai Bunker

chems.name: Super Stimpak
chems.description: This is an incredible melange of healing chems designed to aid wounded soldiers on the battlefield in crucial moments of combat. Super stimpaks come in a large clamp that fit around the arm and inject the chemicals into the user at various times, maximizing the effects of the chemicals. Super stimpaks heal 5d10+50 HP, but the user loses 1d10 HP after an hour from the aftershock. Not addictive.

chems.name: Military Trauma Pack
chems.description: A chemical concoction made by the USA for use in battle, Trauma Packs send the cellular reproduction process into overdrive, healing 6d10+60 hit points instantly, but causing 2d10+30 points of damage after 1 hour. Not addictive.
chems.flavor: What does IFAK even stand for?

chems.name: Mutie
chems.description: Mutie is a chemical that reproduces the effects of the Forced Evolutionary Virus for a short time. After injecting this drug, the user gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Perception, -4 to Charisma, and -4 to Intelligence for 1d10 hours. After that time, the user must make a successful roll against Endurance; if the roll fails, they take 4d10 points of damage. Note that super-mutants will experience no effects from taking Mutie. Mutie is 20% addictive.

chems.name: Ultra Stimpack
chems.description: The most powerful healing substance on the planet, Ultra Stimpacks turn cellular reproduction into a frenzy of activity, healing 10d10+50 HP immediately upon injection. In 1d10 hours, the user must make a roll against Endurance. If that roll fails, they lose every hit point the Ultra Stimpack healed; if the roll succeeds, the user loses half of those hit points. Ultra Stimpacks are only available in technology-rich organizations like the Brotherhood of Steel or the Enclave.

negative.damage: All healed HP (Endurance roll fails) or half (succeeds)

chems.name: Radaway
chems.description: Radaway, an obscure drug from prewar times, became one of the most useful after the bombs went off. It comes in an IV bag and must be taken through a drip IV over the period of about an hour. The Radaway works in the user's system to bond with radioactive particles and wash them out. 1 day after use, the user loses 25 rads. 2 days after use, the user loses another 25 rads. Radaway, unfortunately, has an addiction rate of 20%.
chems.flavor: I Feel Like My Teeth Are Still Glowing

positive.radiation_reduction: 25 rads (1 day later), 25 rads (2 days later)

chems.name: Rad-X
chems.description: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure, and that was the idea behind these drugs. Rad-X is a pill that increases the user's Radiation Resistance by 50% for 1d10 hours after ingestion by creating a kind of radiation 'anti-body' in the user. Not addictive.
